summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center detailing security expectations and training for staff following Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. The memo addresses management concerns and reinforces protocols, including the requirement that Epstein be housed with a cellmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center who was found unresponsive in his cell after an apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. The memorandum outlines enhanced security expectations for his supervision.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: In the early morning hours, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center after an apparent suicide attempt.

events.title: Informal Security Training Sessions
events.description: During the week of July 31, 2019, informal training sessions were held with Correctional Services Supervisors and Line Staff assigned to the Special Housing Unit to address management concerns regarding inmate Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in the early morning hours of July 23, 2019, after an apparent suicide attempt.
The memorandum, dated August 10, 2019, was written to reinforce security expectations following the incident.
Informal training sessions were held with staff during the week of July 31, 2019, to address management concerns and emphasize vigilance.
Specific security concerns cited included blocked observation windows, torn bed sheets, clothing covering light fixtures, clotheslines, and accumulation of food trays in cells.
The SHU Lieutenant was explicitly reminded on several occasions that inmate Epstein was to be housed with a cellmate.
